      • tickUpdated

        protected int tickUpdated
        This is a shortcut for myself. Instead of having to loop through all the neurons available FOR EACH NEURON in order to figure out if a neuron should trigger, this will do the calculations once per tick. If a neuron already was triggered by another neuron, just use the strength provided by that neuron.

      • lastResult

        protected double lastResult

    • Method Detail

      • setAllowNegativeValues

        public Neuron setAllowNegativeValues​(boolean b)
        For some neurons, it may be better to not allow negative values. To fix this, allowNegitiveValues will force deeplearningutil and the neuronrandomizer to keep the neurons between 0 and 1. This should help in certain cases where neurons should not interfere with the values of others, but instead focus on Individualizing traits
        Parameters:
        b - If the neuron should allow negative values
        Returns:
        The neuron instance, so you can chain these modifications.

      • allowNegativeValues

        public boolean allowNegativeValues()

      • setTemperaryDropout

        public void setTemperaryDropout​(boolean b)
        Dropping-out is a method used to cause the NN to generalize. Dropped-out neurons will not be activate, and because of that, will not contribute to the output value, causing other neurons when training to contribute more. Manually "turns on" the drop-out
        Parameters:
        b -

      • droppedOut

        public boolean droppedOut()
        Dropping-out is a method used to cause the NN to generalize. Dropped-out neurons will not be activate, and because of that, will not contribute to the output value, causing other neurons when training to contribute more.
        Returns:

      • setUseThreshold

        public Neuron setUseThreshold​(boolean b)
        For some cases, having a threshold for a neuron can be bad, as sometimes neurons may never fire or never want to fire, losing data. To fix this, useThreshold determines if thresholds should be considered when determining if a neuron isTriggered. If you need logic gates, use thresholds. If you need to see similarities, and not have a pre-defined cut-off for what is and is not something, disable thresholds.
        Parameters:
        b - should use thresholds
        Returns:
        The neuron instance, so you can chain multiple methods if needed.

      • useThreshold

        public boolean useThreshold()
        For some cases, having a threshold for a neuron can be bad, as sometimes neurons may never fire or never want to fire, losing data. To fix this, useThreshold determines if thresholds should be considered when determining if a neuron isTriggered. If you need logic gates, use thresholds. If you need to see similarities, and not have a pre-defined cut-off for what is and is not something, disable thresholds.

      • isTriggered

        public boolean isTriggered()

      • getOutputForNeuron

        public double getOutputForNeuron​(Neuron n)
        Returns the output for a neuron, factoring the weight, output strength, and trigger strength. Will return 0 if the provided neuron is not an output for this neuron
        Parameters:
        n - The output neuron to be tested
        Returns:
        the total output strength, or 0 if it is not an output.
